intro: Lepidium ferganense, commonly known as the Fergana cress, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and its ability to thrive in rocky or arid environments. It typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters and produces small, edible seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
